title: HEMINGWAY BOOK COVER FONTS
content:
Hi genius typeheads -

I'm trying to identify the FOR WHOM THE BELL TOLLS font used on this book cover - looks like a condensed Bodoni, but the R is very different...  
Any ideas?

Also, the script for ERNEST HEMINGWAY.

Thanks so much!  
A.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ba0061_enlarge_4223.jpg)
author: anniemack

comments.content: It's almost like Fenice, but needs to be more condensed..... hmmmmm

Book covers of this era generally used hand lettered titles rather than direct application of fonts.  
There is a font with the almost identical letter-forms, but a narrower aspect created by Sol Hess in 1938 as Spire. There are digital versions by Ann Pomeroy that could be expanded in width. Use the regular version and substitute some letters, such as \_R\_ from the expert version.  
Regular

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SpireRegInUseAsBells_4149.gif)
  
Expert  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SpireExpertInUseAsBells_5208.gif)

Don

Just noticed the Lanston version where the matching letter-forms are in a single font

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LTCSpireAsBells_6687.gif)
  [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-spire/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-spire/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/lanston/ltc-spire/")  
Don

Really like these ones.  
First looks reminds me of [Georg Trump's Amati](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/luc.devroye.org/fonts-26218.html), some sort of cross-over between [Fenice](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/fenice) (hemi-arrowheads serifs) and [Corvinus](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/corvinus) (geometric and squarish).  
Some alternatives: **[Amati RMU](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/rmu/amati-pro)/ [Amati AR](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/artypes/amati-ar)** (Fenice = Corvinus, main difference on /R leg), [Vincenzo](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/vincenzo) (Fenice \>\> Corvinus), [Flenja](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/stereotypes/flenja) (Fenice \> Corvinus), [Elongated Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/aboutype/elongated-roman) (almost perfect but really too thin), [Latin Small MK](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.ffonts.net/LatinSmall.font) (Latin \>\> Fenice \>\> Corvinus), [Latino Elongated](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/latino-elongated) (Latin \>\> Fenice \>\> Corvinus)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Amati-CEWeber-1952-GeorgTrump_5265.jpg)

Second looks very modern. Alternatives: [Seagrass](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bomparte/seagrass-bf) BF, Sudtipos [Storefront](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/storefront-pro) and [Buffet](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sudtipos/buffet-script), [Stainy](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/stainy), CBdO [Sarah](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/charlesborges/sarah-script) and [Alpine](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/charlesborges/alpine-script), [Hemmet](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mawns/hemmet), **[Dream Lover](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeart/dream-lover)** (very close)
Thanks guys! Yes, such a beautiful typeface. And spire is a really great match! thanks!!!!!

As I had good time tracking these ones, I redo for fun the cover with Amati and Dream Lover, limiting edition and rework to the maximum.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141008164140im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Untitled-1_3941.png)

Ryuk, your edited version of Amati -- with leg on \_R\_ altered -- works well.  
Don
